Review.Titre: Awful customer service and reliability
Review.Contenu: Great at first, but severely let down by terrible customer service.Let me explain, as if you have looked at the other reviews and see 5 stars, then 1, you may be confused. This is because when people first start, Podia is all good. It is after all quite simple (if not a bit restrictive, but there are workarounds) and it seems generous with features. Hence the 5 stars when you first sign up.But if you’re like myself and others who run anything more than a side project as a hobby, where the service needs to be reliable, robust and supportive, then the cracks appear quite fast.As many others have said, their support is very bad. The customer service do not listen and will never admit they have done something wrong, like give you the wrong information about a service. I signed up for their email plan on top of my hosting, so $1000 a year now, and yet I still cannot remove the Podia branding from all my emails, even though I was told this would be the case.To hide their branding on your content when a customer is paying so much is just greedy and unprofessional. They are only concerned with getting you on board and your money, and do not give you the money back if their service fails!This year they had an outage of nearly 24 hours. That’s every site hosted with them, down, no sign ups, no access for customers. That was my full business down! They never gave a reason why this happened, just said it won’t happen again. And yesterday they]ir databases went down for a while, with no warning. The communication is awful and it affects your business.I and several other business owners are planning to move away from the platform. The more you talk about it to them on private channels, the more you realise Podia has a severe problem in their company ethos, and do not care for existing customers, just wanting new ones to sign up instead.I highly advise you to look at other services and see if you can simplify what you offer, especially if running a business from your provider. I am really sad Podia has become so greedy, but when you can’t get in touch with anyone for many hours, or a straight answer for support, it is not a viable option for my livelihood.Just FYI: I would suggest a combination of Vimeo Pro, Mailchimp and Stripe/PayPal or similar, if you are looking fo run a course with video content. Many services now allow password protected, paywall web pages and services like Mailchimp are so much better at handling your data, plus their customer service actually provides service!

Review.Titre: Initially I loved Podia... THEN the issues
Review.Contenu: Initially I loved Podia. Clean interface, the ability to drip content over time, upsells, embedded checkout buttons you can put on your native site (I use squarespace and this was essential for me). BUT I have had issue after issue after issue, and I'm starting to feel like the issues will never stop.1) Despite the advertising that you can checkout on your native site, when I tested this function during my launch (right as they changed their checkout design), every other time I would check out I would be sent to podia to checkout (instead of it being a native popup on my site). This was one of the main reasons I signed up for podia, so to have it glitch out so much, was a serious let down. It seems to be more consistent now, but now I check it all the time because I'm constantly afraid it might not work.2) The other issue that started when they redesigned their checkout was that upsells were no longer available in native checkout (which I was never notified of, I just had to discover this for myself), and redirected to the podia website even when the checkout for the course alone did work. Now, I have no upsells at all to avoid this clunky redirect. It's again such a let down. It was working fine until they updated their checkout. SO if you're looking to include upsells (which were another reason why I choose Podia), in your native checkout, look elsewhere. 3) Additionally, when I first launched my course I set up an automatic redirect after someone would checkout so that they could go to my custom thank you page... this utterly failed and Podia couldn't figure out why. They said it was because I was using deadline funnel (a SUPER common tool for course creators). But that sounds like a them issue, as about every serious course creator I know uses deadline funnel. It seems to be working now. But it still pains me to think that my customers were sent to my literal homepage after purchase, making my course look super scammy, almost as if they didn't even check out.4) Now, I found out today that one of my customers is on the wrong schedule for their drip content despite them signing up when everyone else did. Their content is being released 1 week before everyone else's, which is a huge issue as I'm creating the content week to week, so she's just seeing placeholders that should be hidden to her.SIGH. With all the money I've spent (now being on Podia a couple years), I honestly have regret. Spending originally $79 and now $89 a month to get these 4 functionalities... to only have them glitch out on me, makes me wish I had gotten started with a more established platform. But now since my students are already signed up and are in the middle of the course, I feel like I can't leave.P.S. The only reason why I gave 2 stars instead of 1 is that their customer service is consistently kind... even if their tech seems to be very inconsistent and their customer service people can't help that.
